pages.text: You found a plethora of colorful flowers growing around forests and plains in small patches. What's up with those? Definitely worth a look if you haven't tinkered with them already.

pages.title: Crushing Petals
pages.text: While crushing flowers seems a bit unorthodox, it _did_ work. No problem plucking the petals from the flattened blossom after that.

pages.title: Ink from Petals
pages.text: Having studied not only botany but also color theory, you definitely recognize some similarities. The colored flowers, resemble [Colored Trees](book://general/colored_trees) in more than just one point.\\No wonder that their petals can also be used to create [Ink](book://magic/ink).

pages.title: Glimmering Flowers
pages.text: Adding some [Shimmerstone](book://resources/shimmerstone) to magical flowers makes them glimmer.

pages.title: Colored Mushrooms
pages.text: Applying [Pigment](book://general/pigment) to mushrooms colors them in the respective color.
Using [Pigment](book://general/pigment) instead of mundane Dye when creating [#](bb00bb)Floral Fertilizer[#]() is quite a bit more yielding.
The [#](bb00bb)Black Lotus[#]() is a great source of Mana, no questions asked. But yet, it still can be enhanced. Using some [#](449900)Jade Petals[#]()
Those elusive seeds you could only find in chests hidden around the world? Pricey - maybe not even worth the hassle - but you finally found a way to replicate them.

pages.title: Enchanted Soil
pages.text: Enchanted Soil can be harvested using tools enchanted with [Resonance](book://enchanting/resonance).
